value:
Hello!!
This is your Class 12 for Spoken English course module.
Level 1
Pair and Share:
What is your favorite hobby ?
What is the one skill that you would like to learn ?
Which is your favorite subject at school and why ?
Game time

Similes & Metaphors
Similes - A comparison of 2 things using words like “like” or “as”. For example, “As sly as a fox”.
Metaphor - A direct comparison of 2 words without using “like” or “as”.
An example of a metaphor is “Life is a journey”. This means that life is long and has many ups and downs like any journey.
A)“I am feeling blue”
Metaphor
Blue color represents sadness - I am feeling sad
Example: I am feeling blue because my team lost the match
B) “Cool as a cucumber”
Simile
Relaxed, or chilled out - not stressed
Example: On the first day of class, I felt cool as a cucumber
C) “The test was a piece of cake”
Metaphor
Meaning: The test was easy - Easy, since cake is pretty easy and yummy to eat
Example: The test was a piece of cake, I am going to get 100%
D) “Busy as a bee”
Simile
Meaning: Very busy, like a bee constantly buzzes

Example: My mom is as busy as a bee

E) “He is a shining star”
Metaphor
Meaning: He is outstanding
Example: He helped me so much, he is a shining star

F) “Slept like a log”
4. Simile
Meaning: To sleep very soundly, it may be hard to wake you up up - like if you were a log
Example: I was so tired, I slept like a log”
G) “ You are my sunshine”
Metaphor
Meaning: You are bright and bring happiness to my life, like sunshine
Context: Can use this while thanking a loved one.
H) “She has a bubbly personality”
Metaphor
Meaning: Person who is cheerful - like the bubbles in soda

Example: Her bubbly personality makes everyone happy

I) “As quiet as a mouse”
Simile
Meaning: Very quiet, like a mouse
Example: I didn’t hear him walking, he was as quiet as a mouse
Word of the Week
Attendance (noun): the action or state of going regularly to or being present at a place or event.

Attend (verb)
Eg.: Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.
I want to attend my friend's birthday party.
Alternate usage: the number of times a person attends
a student who has perfect attendance [=a student who has been
present at every class]
Pair and Share:
What is your favorite hobby ?
What is the one skill you would like to learn ?
Which is your favorite subject at school and why ?
Game time
Similes, Metaphors and Idioms
Similes - A comparison of 2 things using words like “like” or “as”. For example, “As sly as a fox”.
Metaphor - A direct comparison of 2 words without using “like” or “as”.
An example of a metaphor is “Life is a journey”. This means that life is long and has many ups and downs like any journey.
Idiom - An expression that means something different than the words used.
A)“I am feeling blue”
Metaphor
Blue color represents sadness - I am feeling sad
Example: I am feeling blue because my team lost the match
B) “Cool as a cucumber”
Simile
Relaxed, or chilled out - not stressed
Example: On the first day of class, I felt cool as a cucumber
C) “The test was a piece of cake”
Metaphor
Meaning: The test was easy - Easy, since cake is pretty easy and yummy to eat
Example: The test was a piece of cake, I am going to get 100%
D) “When pigs fly”
Idiom
Meaning: It will never happen
Example: A: “Can we climb Mount Everest?” B: “When pigs fly”
E) “He is a shining star”
Metaphor
Meaning: He is outstanding
Example: He helped me so much, he is a shining star
F) “Give it a shot”
Idiom
Meaning: To try to do something
Example: Give it a shot, you might succeed.
G) “ You are my sunshine”
Metaphor
Meaning: You are bright and bring happiness to my life, like sunshine
Context: Can use this while thanking a loved one.
H) “Butterflies in my stomach”
Idiom
Meaning: Feeling nervous - refers to the feeling in your stomach
Example: I had butterflies in my stomach before my speech
I) “As quiet as a mouse”
Simile
Meaning: Very quiet, like a mouse
Example: I didn’t hear him walking, he was as quiet as a mouse
G) “She has a bubbly personality”
Metaphor
Meaning: Person who is cheerful - like the bubbles in soda
Example: Her bubbly personality makes everyone happy
H) “Slept like a log”
Simile
Meaning: To sleep very soundly, it may be hard to wake you up up - like if you were a log
Example: I was so tired, I slept like a log”
Word of the Week
Attendance (noun): the action or state of going regularly to or being present at a place or event.
Attend (verb)

Eg.: Attendance at the meeting is mandatory.
I want to attend my friend's birthday party.
Alternate usage: the number of times a person attends a student who has perfect attendance [=a student who has been present at every class]

Attention: notice taken of someone or something; the regarding of someone or something as interesting or
important.
Eg.: You should pay attention to what she says.
